com.ibm.jaggr.core.config

Interface IConfig.IPackage

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigImpl.Package
    Enclosing interface:
    IConfig

    public static interface IConfig.IPackage
    Interface for a server-side AMD module package. The definition of server-side packages mirrors the definition of client-side packages (see Packages), except that instead of mapping module ids to resources on the web, the server-side package maps module ids to resources on the server.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IConfig.Location getLocation()
      Returns the value of the location property of the package.
      String getMain()
      Returns resolved value of the main propery of the package.
      String getName()
      Returns the value of the name property of the package.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the value of the name property of the package.
        Returns:
        The package name

      • getLocation

        IConfig.Location getLocation()
        Returns the value of the location property of the package.

        Locations are relative to the baseUrl configuration value, unless they contain a protocol or start with a front slash (/).

        Returns:
        The package location on the server

      • getMain

        String getMain()
        Returns resolved value of the main propery of the package.

        The main module is returned when someone does a require for the package. The default config value is ./main, so it needs to be specified only if it differs from the default. Note that unlike location, which specifies the URI to a resource on the server, main specifies a module id that is mapped to a server resource using the defined paths and packages. The value returned by this method is the resolved module id obtained by combining the package name with the value specified for the main property in the config JavaScript if the main property is relative, or the value of the main property if it is non-relative.

        Returns:
        The resolved value of the main property of the package, or <package-name>/main if no main property is specified.
